meanings.definition: To choose or select one person or thing from a group
meanings.sent1: She singled out the best student for the award.
meanings.sent2: The teacher singled out the student who answered all the questions correctly.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone was surprised when she singled out the quietest person to lead the dance.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of faces, he singled out his best friend with a wave.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight singled out the lead singer on stage.

meanings.definition: To focus on or pay attention to one person or thing
meanings.sent1: During the presentation, she singled on the important details.
meanings.sent2: The coach singled on the star player's performance during the game.
meanings.sent3: In the noisy room, he singled on the soft melody playing in the background.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes singled on the beautiful painting hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The detective singled on the suspicious behavior of the suspect.

meanings.definition: To separate or distinguish one person or thing from others
meanings.sent1: The judge singled the winner from the rest of the contestants.
meanings.sent2: The software can single specific data points from the overall dataset.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to single the chosen card from the deck.
meanings.sent4: The unique scent of the flower singled it out from the other blooms.
meanings.sent5: The detective was able to single the culprit based on the footprint evidence.
